claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A tabular listing of influenza vaccines for the United States 2023–24 season, including trade names, manufacturers, presentations (e.g., 0.5-mL prefilled syringe, multi-dose vial), age indications, hemagglutinin content per dose, route of administration, and mercury (thimerosal) content. The table does not mention vaccine production mutations, egg adaptations, or any impact on effectiveness; it only provides dosing and formulation details, so it does not support the claim.
